member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.BufferProtectUnprotectResult
member.summary: Contains information about the result from protecting or unprotecting an enterprise protected buffer.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.BufferProtectUnprotectResult.Buffer
member.summary: Gets the enterprise protected buffer that has been protected or unprotected.
member.returns: The enterprise protected buffer.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.BufferProtectUnprotectResult.ProtectionInfo
member.summary: Gets the DataProtectionInfo object concerning the enterprise protected buffer that has been protected or unprotected.
member.returns: The info object concerning the enterprise protected buffer.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionInfo
member.summary: Contains information about an enterprise protected buffer or stream.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionInfo.Identity
member.summary: The enterprise identity of the enterprise protected buffer or stream.
member.returns: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionInfo.Status
member.summary: The protection status of the enterprise protected buffer or stream.
member.returns: A value of the DataProtectionStatus enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager
member.summary: Provides access to operations that manage buffers and streams that are protected to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.GetProtectionInfoAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Get the status of an enterprise protected buffer.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a DataProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the buffer.
member.param: The buffer for which protection status is being queried.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.GetStreamProtectionInfoAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream)
member.summary: Get the status of an enterprise protected stream.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a DataProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the stream.
member.param: The stream for which protection status is being queried.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.ProtectAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer,System.String)
member.summary: Protect the data in a buffer to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a BufferProtectUnprotectResult object that contains the status of the newly protected buffer.
member.param: The buffer to be protected.
The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.ProtectStreamAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream,System.String,Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream)
member.summary: Protect a stream of data to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a DataProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the protected stream.
member.param: The input, unprotected stream.
The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
The output, protected stream.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.UnprotectAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IBuffer)
member.summary: Removes the protection to an enterprise identity from a buffer.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a BufferProtectUnprotectResult object that contains the status of the unprotected buffer.
member.param: The buffer to be unprotected.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionManager.UnprotectStreamAsync(Windows.Storage.Streams.IInputStream,Windows.Storage.Streams.IOutputStream)
member.summary: Removes the protection to an enterprise identity from a stream of data.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a DataProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the unprotected stream.
member.param: The input, protected stream.
The output, unprotected stream.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus
member.summary: Describes the enterprise identity protection state of a buffer or stream.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.AccessSuspended
member.summary: The keys to access the protected item have been dropped while the device is locked.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.LicenseExpired
member.summary: The item's RMS license has expired.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.Protected
member.summary: The item is protected.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.ProtectedToOtherIdentity
member.summary: The item is protected to another enterprise identity.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.Revoked
member.summary: The protection of the item has been revoked.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.DataProtectionStatus.Unprotected
member.summary: The item is not protected to an enterprise identity.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.EnforcementLevel
member.summary: A set of enumerated values together describing the possible enterprise data protection (EDP) enforcement levels. EDP enforcement level is one aspect of mobile device management (MDM) policy configuration.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.EnforcementLevel.Block
member.summary: The policy calls for the user to be blocked. In response to an attempted action such as pasting data into an unauthorized app, your app should block the action, and audit it.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.EnforcementLevel.NoProtection
member.summary: The policy calls for no protection. Your app should disable EDP behavior if data is protected, and unprotect data.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.EnforcementLevel.Override
member.summary: The policy calls for the user to be allowed to override a warning message. In response to an attempted action such as pasting data into an unauthorized app, your app should prompt the user via an overridable warning message. If the user overrides, then your app should perform the action and audit it.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.EnforcementLevel.Silent
member.summary: The policy calls for silent protection. Your app should not prompt in response to an action such as pasting data into an unauthorized app. Instead, your app should silently allow the action, and audit it.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionInfo
member.summary: Contains information about an enterprise protected file.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionInfo.Identity
member.summary: The enterprise identity of the enterprise protected file.
member.returns: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionInfo.IsRoamable
member.summary: Specifies if the protection of the enterprise protected file can be roamed to other devices.
member.returns: true if the file's protection can be roamed to other devices.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionInfo.Status
member.summary: The protection status of the enterprise protected file.
member.returns: A value of the FileProtectionStatus enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager
member.summary: Provides access to operations that manage files that are protected to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.CopyProtectionAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem,Windows.Storage.IStorageItem)
member.summary: Replicate the file protection of one file onto another file.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns true if the file protection was copied, or false if there was an error.
member.param: The source file, from which file protection is being copied.
The target file, to which file protection is being copied.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.CreateProtectedAndOpenAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFolder,System.String,System.String,Windows.Storage.CreationCollisionOption)
member.summary: Create an enterprise-protected file.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a ProtectedFileCreateResult object representing the newly created protected file.
member.param: The folder into which to create the enterprise protected file.
The desired name of the new enterprise protected file.
The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
A CreationCollisionOption value that specifies what to do if desiredName already exists.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.GetProtectionInfoAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem)
member.summary: Get the status of an enterprise-protected file.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a FileProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the file.
member.param: The file or folder for which protection status is being queried.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.IsContainerAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Use this property to determine whether the storage file is actually a container with a file contained within it.
member.returns: true if the storage file is a container, and false if it is not.
member.param: The file that you want to determine is a container or not.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.LoadFileFromContainerAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Create an enterprise-protected file, and load it from a container file.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a ProtectedContainerImportResult object representing the newly created protected file.
member.param: The enterprise protected file to be created and loaded.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.LoadFileFromContainerAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile,Windows.Storage.IStorageItem)
member.summary: Create an enterprise-protected file in a specified storage item (such as a folder), and load it from a container file.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a ProtectedContainerImportResult object representing the newly created protected file.
member.param: The enterprise protected file to be created and loaded.
The storage item into which to create the enterprise protected file.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.LoadFileFromContainerAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile,Windows.Storage.IStorageItem,Windows.Storage.NameCollisionOption)
member.summary: Create an enterprise-protected file in a specified storage item (such as a folder), and load it from a container file.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a ProtectedContainerImportResult object representing the newly created protected file.
member.param: The enterprise protected file to be created and loaded.
The storage item into which to create the enterprise protected file.
The enum value that determines how Windows responds if the created file has the same name as an existing item in the container's location.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.ProtectAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem,System.String)
member.summary: Protect the data in a file to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a FileProtectionInfo object that contains the status of the newly protected file.
member.param: The file to be protected.

The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Use ProtectionPolicyManager.IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed before using the identity to protect a file.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionManager.SaveFileAsContainerAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageFile)
member.summary: Save an enterprise-protected file as a containerized version.
member.returns: When the call to this method completes successfully, it returns a ProtectedContainerExportResult object representing the newly created container file.
member.param: The protected source file being copied.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus
member.summary: Describes the enterprise protection state of a file or folder.
member.deprecated: Undetermined may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use Unknown.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.AccessSuspended
member.summary: The keys to access the protected item have been dropped while the device is locked.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.FileInUse
member.summary: The item is being used by another process. You can apply enterprise protection to it only after it becomes exclusively available.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.LicenseExpired
member.summary: The item's RMS license has expired.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.NotProtectable
member.summary: The item is encrypted or is a system file and cannot be protected using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.Protected
member.summary: The item is protected using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.ProtectedByOtherUser
member.summary: ProtectedByOtherUser may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use ProtectedToOtherIdentity.Another user has protected the item using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.ProtectedToOtherEnterprise
member.summary: ProtectedToOtherEnterprise may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use ProtectedToOtherIdentity.The item is protected for another enterprise id using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.ProtectedToOtherIdentity
member.summary: The item is protected for another enterprise identity using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.Revoked
member.summary: The item has been revoked using enterprise protection.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.Undetermined
member.summary: Undetermined may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use Unknown.The item is either encrypting or decrypting and the enterprise protection status cannot be determined. Check again later.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The item is either encrypting or decrypting and the enterprise protection status cannot be determined. Check again later.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileProtectionStatus.Unprotected
member.summary: The item is not protected using enterprise protection.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileRevocationManager
member.summary: Provides access to Selective Wipe operations.
member.deprecated: FileRevocationManager may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use FileProtectionManager.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileRevocationManager.CopyProtectionAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem,Windows.Storage.IStorageItem)
member.summary: Copy the selective wipe protection state of a file or folder to a new file or folder.
member.deprecated: FileRevocationManager may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use FileProtectionManager.
member.returns: True if the copy operation was successful; otherwise false.
member.param: The source item to copy the selective wipe protection status from.
The target item to copy the selective wipe protection status to.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileRevocationManager.GetStatusAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem)
member.summary: Gets the selective wipe protection status for a file or folder.
member.deprecated: FileRevocationManager may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use FileProtectionManager.
member.returns: An aysnchronous operation that retrieves the selective wipe protection status for the storageItem.
member.param: The file or folder to get the selective wipe protection status for.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileRevocationManager.ProtectAsync(Windows.Storage.IStorageItem,System.String)
member.summary: Protects a file or folder for selective wipe.
member.deprecated: FileRevocationManager may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use FileProtectionManager.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that retrieves the selective wipe protection status for the storageItem.
member.param: The file or folder to protect for selective wipe.

The enterprise id that the file or folder is protected for. The enterpriseIdentity value must be formatted as an Internationalized Domain Name (IDN) and cannot contain spaces. For example, contoso.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.FileRevocationManager.Revoke(System.String)
member.summary: Revokes all files and folders protected for selective wipe for a specified enterprise id.
member.deprecated: FileRevocationManager may be unavailable for releases after Windows 10. Instead, use FileProtectionManager.
member.param: Revoke all files and folders protected by selective wipe for this enterprise id. The enterpriseIdentity value must be formatted as an Internationalized Domain Name (IDN) and cannot contain spaces. For example, contoso.com.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus
member.summary: Possible status values for an enterprise protected file that has been imported from or exported to a container file.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.AccessSuspended
member.summary: The keys to access the protected file have been dropped while the device is locked.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.LicenseExpired
member.summary: The file's RMS license has expired.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.NotRoamable
member.summary: The file cannot be roamed to another device.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.Ok
member.summary: The file's protection is OK.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.ProtectedToOtherIdentity
member.summary: The file is inaccessible, as it is protected to a different enterprise identity.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.Revoked
member.summary: The file's protection has been revoked, and it is inaccessible.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.Undetermined
member.summary: The file's protection can not be determined.

member.name: F:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectedImportExportStatus.Unprotected
member.summary: The file is not protected.

member.name: T:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager
member.summary: Manages enterprise-protection policy on protected content.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.Identity
member.summary: Gets or sets the enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.IsProtectionEnabled
member.summary: Use this property to determine whether enterprise data protection (EDP) is enabled on the device.
member.returns: true if EDP is enabled on the device, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.ShowEnterpriseIndicator
member.summary: A value indicating whether or not the shell should decorate a window to show that it is an enterprise window.
member.returns: true to indicate that the shell should decorate a window to show that it is an enterprise window, otherwise false.

member.name: E:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.PolicyChanged
member.summary: An event that is raised in response to changes in enterprise data protection (EDP) policy managed by the Policy CSP.

member.name: E:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.ProtectedAccessResumed
member.summary: Event with which the app registers to receive notification that protection has been resumed.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: E:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.ProtectedAccessSuspending
member.summary: Event with which the app registers to receive notification that protection is to be suspended.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: E:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.ProtectedContentRevoked
member.summary: Event with which your app registers to receive notification that protection is to be revoked.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.CheckAccess(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Request if access to enterprise-protected content is available to an identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: A value of the ProtectionPolicyEvaluationResult enumeration that is the result of the query.
member.param: The source enterprise identity of the app. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to check if an email address or domain is managed.
The enterprise identity you want to check has access to the protected content.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.CheckAccessForApp(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Perform enterprise-protection policy evaluation for a data transfer between your app and a specific target app.
member.returns: A value of the ProtectionPolicyEvaluationResult enumeration that is the result of the query.
member.param: The source enterprise identity of the app. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to check if an email address or domain is managed.
The package family name of the app you want to check has access to the protected content.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.ClearProcessUIPolicy
member.summary: Clear UI policy enforcement for an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.CreateCurrentThreadNetworkContext(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ThreadNetworkContext protected to an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: The protected network context. The app must call ThreadNetworkContext.Close after access to the resource is completed.
member.param: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. This may be returned from GetPrimaryManagedIdentityForNetworkEndpoint; otherwise your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.GetEnforcementLevel(System.String)
member.summary: You can use this method to determine the current enterprise data protection (EDP) enforcement level. EDP enforcement level is one aspect of mobile device management (MDM) policy configuration.
member.returns: A value of the EnforcementLevel enumeration.
member.param: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Returns the ProtectionPolicyManager object associated with the current app window.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: The ProtectionPolicyManager object associated with the current app window.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.GetPrimaryManagedIdentityForNetworkEndpointAsync(Windows.Networking.HostName)
member.summary: Returns the enterprise identity of a network resource if the resource is on an enterprise-policy-managed endpoint.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: The enterprise identity.
member.param: The host name or IP address of the network resource.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.HasContentBeenRevokedSince(System.String,Windows.Foundation.DateTime)
member.summary: Use this method to check (for a known identity that is managed or ever was managed) whether access to protected data has been revoked since a specified date and time, or is still accessible.
member.returns: true if access has been revoked since the specified date and time, otherwise false.
member.param: The enterprise identity protecting the data. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
The date and time from which point forward you want to include in the check.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.IsIdentityManaged(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if an enterprise entity is managed by an enterprise policy.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: true if the enterprise identity is managed, or false if it is not.
member.param: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.IsProtectionUnderLockRequired(System.String)
member.summary: Use this property to determine the value of the ProtectionUnderLockConfigRequired enterprise data protection (EDP) policy.
member.returns: true if ProtectionUnderLockConfigRequired policy is set for the identity, otherwise false.
member.param: The enterprise identity you want to check has ProtectionUnderLockConfigRequired policy set.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.IsUserDecryptionAllowed(System.String)
member.summary: Use this property to determine whether decryption of files protected by enterprise data protection (EDP) is allowed.
member.returns: true if decryption of files protected by EDP is allowed, otherwise false.
member.param: The enterprise identity you want to check has access to the protected content.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.LogAuditEvent(System.String,System.String,Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyAuditInfo)
member.summary: Causes an audit event to be logged.
member.param: The enterprise identity to which the content is protected. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
The enterprise identity to which the content is being disclosed. This is an email address or domain.
An audit info object; an instance of ProtectionPolicyAuditInfo.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.RequestAccessAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Request access to enterprise protected content for an identity.

member.param: The enterprise identity to which the content is protected. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
The enterprise identity to which the content is being disclosed. This is an email address or domain.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.RevokeContent(System.String)
member.summary: Revoke the keys required to access all content protected to the specified enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.param: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.

member.name: M:Windows.Security.EnterpriseData.ProtectionPolicyManager.TryApplyProcessUIPolicy(System.String)
member.summary: Enables UI policy enforcement for an enterprise identity.
member.capability: Required for apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device.
member.returns: true if the identity is being managed by an enterprise policy, or false if it is not.
member.param: The enterprise identity. This is an email address or domain that is managed. Your app should use IsIdentityManaged to confirm that an email address or domain is managed.
